result.execSummary:
The defendant Arianna J. Lawler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court finds defendant eligible for CIP and SAP as soon as statutorily eligible.

superMiscConds.notes: To be paid during extended supervision.

May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No firearms or body armor.
Provide DNA sample on 11-23-2015.
Pay DNA surcharge.

Remain free of all drugs, except prescriptions to be taken as prescribed.
No alcohol.
No contact with any known drug users.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
